item.title: Ex-splined: beyond splines for modeling umpire calls
item.description: What do we know about how baseball umpires call balls and strikes? A lot, actually. As those familiar with the game know, balls and strikes are determined by umpires applying the written rules of the game, which means they visually compare the location of a pitched ball to both home plate and batter anatomy. Weâ€™ll get to those rules below. But published models of umpire calls ignore the rules and how umpires apply them.
